alert.note: Alert for Adams; Brown; Highland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 11:50AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL BROWN, NORTHWESTERN ADAMS AND SOUTHWESTERN HIGHLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 PM EDT... At 1150 AM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Sardinia to 8 miles northeast of Ripley, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... West Union, Winchester, Sardinia, Seaman, Emerald, Decatur, Russellville, Mowrystown, Cherry Fork, Redoak, Lake Waynoka, Fincastle and State Route 32 at US Route 62. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
